title: The DISASTER RISK MANAGEMENT (ENFORCEMENT MEASURES) (NO. 3) ORDER
title_en: The DISASTER RISK MANAGEMENT (ENFORCEMENT MEASURES) (NO. 3) ORDER
description: Category: statute | Source: https://laws.moj.gov.jm/library/statute/the-disaster-risk-management-enforcement-measures-no-3-order | Legal areas: Defence and National Security

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Order may be cited as the Disaster Risk Management (Enforcement Measures)
      (No. 3) Order, 2020.
350                     PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS                          [APRIL 8, 2020

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. With effect from April 8, 2020, the measures set out in this Order are directed to be
      enforced for removing or otherwise guarding against or mitigating the threat, or effects, of
      the SARS – CoV-2 (Coronavirus COVID-19) and the possible consequences thereof.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.—(1) For the period from April 8, 2020, to April 21, 2020, no person shall be permitted
      to enter Jamaica.
             (2) Sub-paragraph (1) shall not apply to any person, or category of persons,
      authorised by the Minister responsible for immigration, subject to the prior approval of
      the Cabinet.
               (3) A person who, after March 21, 2020, has been permitted to enter Jamaica, shall—
         (a)      remain in quarantine, at that person’s abode or place of residence, or such other
                  place as may be directed by an authorized officer, for a period of 14 days beginning
                  from the date on which that person was permitted to enter Jamaica; and
         (b)      comply with all applicable directions given, and requirements imposed, by an
                  authorized officer.

provisions.title: Section 6
Section 7
provisions.content:
7.—(1) For the period from April 8, 2020, to April 21, 2020, all persons who can work from
      home should do so.
APRIL 8, 2020]       PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS                                      353
              (2) During the period referred to in sub-paragraph (1), an employer shall have a
     duty, if satisfied that an employee is able to discharge the duties of that employee from the
     employee’s place of residence, to grant the employee permission to do so without imposing
     any adverse consequences to the employee, in respect thereof.
            (3) During the period referred to in sub-paragraph (1), the employer shall not require
     any person who—
           (a)   has attained the age of 70 years or more; or
           (b)   exhibits flu-like symptoms or respiratory symptoms,
     to attend for work at the workplace.
             (4) During the period referred to in sub-paragraph (1), an employer may permit an
     employee who is not able to work from home to nevertheless remain at home in order to
     care for—
           (a)   an elderly or ailing family member; or
           (b)   a child of the employee, if there are no other suitable child care arrangements
                 available for that purpose.
             (5) The grant of permission to an employee under sub-paragraph (2) or a requirement
     in respect of an employee under sub-paragraph (3) shall not count against the leave
     entitlements of that employee, unless otherwise agreed between the employer and employee.
              (6) During the period from April 8, 2020 to May 5, 2020, an employer shall provide
     sufficient number of areas, at the workplace, where any person who is an employee or
     customer of the employer, or any other visitor to the workplace, is able to readily access
     facilities for washing or otherwise sanitizing, that person’s hands.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8.—(1) With effect from April 8, 2020, to April 21, 2020, each of the following persons
     shall remain within that person’s abode or place of residence, except that the person may
     once per day leave that abode or place of residence for food, medicine or other necessities of
     life—
           (a)   a person who has attained the age of 70 years or more;
           (b)   a person who has the “flu” or a respiratory illness.
             (2) Sub-paragraph (1)(a) shall not apply to any person employed in any undertaking
     or entity referred to in paragraph 6(2)(g) or (h), or in any service or activity authorised
     under paragraph 6(2)(r).

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9.—(1) During the period from April 8, 2020, to April 21, 2020 all bars, nightclubs and
     other places of amusement shall remain closed.
            (2) Subject to sub-paragraph (3), during the period from April 8, 2020 to April 21,
     2020 no more than 10 persons at a time shall be permitted to be in any one area of a barber
     shop or hair salon, and no more than 2 of those persons shall be clients waiting to be
     served in that area.
354                   PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS                           [APRIL 8, 2020
              (3) The opening hours of barber shops and hair salons shall be—
            (a)   no earlier than 10:00 am and no later than 5:00 pm during the periods April 8, 2020
                  to April 9, 2020 and April 14, 2020 and April 21, 2020; and
            (b)   no earlier than 8:00 am and no later than 2:00 pm on April 11, 2020,
      except on April 10, 2020 (Good Friday), April 12, 2020 (Easter Sunday) and April 13, 2020
      (Easter Monday), when they shall be closed.
              (4) During the period from April 10, 2020, to April 13, 2020, all public beaches
      (whether licensed under the Beach Control Act or not), water attractions (including rivers
      and falls) and other attractions shall remain closed.
              (5) In sub-paragraph (1), “place of amusement” means any place open to the public,
      whether for a fee or free of charge, for the purpose of entertainment and (without limit to
      the generality of the foregoing) includes a cinema, dance hall, club, open air dance venue,
      amusement arcade, any place where a coin operated amusement machine is open to the
      public, a festival, discotheque, roller disco, or skate rink.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. Every educational institution, as defined in the Education Act, shall remain closed
      until the end of the day of April 21, 2020.

provisions.title: Section 13
Section 14
provisions.content:

     revoked.
  Dated this 8th day of April, 2020.
